definition: slot within a schedule/timeslot (for a TV program, a session with a photographer etc)/range of dates in which an event is to be held (film screening, exhibition etc)
official records/grade (of goods)/file/records/shelves/slot/gap/crosspiece/classifier for crosspieces/classifier for events, affairs etc/Taiwan pr. [dang3]
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: Lunar New Year stalls in the domestic schedule in several schedule really is gold.
sentences.chinese: 贺岁档在国内几大档期中确实属于黄金档期。

sentences.english: And this year it looks like they will be spoiled for choice as fantasy films continue to dominate the Christmas market.
sentences.chinese: 今年，幻想影片仍将继续占据圣诞档期的电影市场。

sentences.english: Beijing has imposed a moratorium on new foreign films.
sentences.chinese: 北京暂缓了所有海外电影的上映档期。

sentences.english: "Overheard 2" will hit the national screens during the summer holidays.
sentences.chinese: 《窃听风云2》将于暑假档期全球上映。

definition: theater chain (abbr. for 電影院線|电影院线)
cast and crew/performers and production team
to begin shooting (a movie, a scene of a movie etc)/to start the bidding (auction)/to start a trading session (stock market)
to premiere (a movie or TV show)/premiere (of a movie)/first-run (movie)/to greet (the eye) before anything else (e.g. when entering a room)
cast (of a movie etc)/lineup of performers/troupe
